intro: Centaurea patibilcensis, commonly known as the Kashmir centaury, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and spiny, bristly leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cold and dry conditions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea patibilcensis is often found in meadows and open slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters.
